item.title: 「Big Brother Whale」 Liquidates YZY Longs, Losing $529,000
item.description: On August 23rd, based on on-chain data, "Brother Ma" Huang Licheng has liquidated his YZY long position, incurring a loss of $529,000. Currently, he only holds ETH and HYPE long positions, with an overall unrealized profit of more than $3.6 million.His PUMP long position was closed with a loss of $52,000, and his BTC long position was closed with a loss of $29,000.

item.title: BAND Surges Over 47% in 24 Hours, Market Cap Reaches $167 Million
item.description: On August 23rd, based on HTX market data, BAND saw a surge of more than 47% in the past 24 hours. It is currently trading at $1.219 and has a market capitalization of $167 million.

item.title: The SEC Crypto Enforcement Group is currently conducting a roadshow, organizing a roundtable discussion, and listening to perspectives from representatives in the crypto space.
item.description: On August 23rd, as per official information, the Cryptocurrency Special Task Force of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is carrying out a national roadshow and hosting a series of roundtable discussions. The Cryptocurrency Special Task Force desires to listen to those who were unable to attend the roundtable meetings held in Washington, D.C. in the past, as well as the voices that may have been historically underrepresented in other policy-making processes. The task force is fully aware that any regulatory framework will have extensive implications, and thus it aims to ensure that communication and engagement are as comprehensive as possible. The schedule for the Cryptocurrency Task Force's roadshow is as follows:August 4th: Berkeley, CaliforniaAugust 19th: BostonSeptember 4th: DallasSeptember 15th: ChicagoSeptember 25th: New York CityOctober 2nd: Los AngelesOctober 24th: ClevelandOctober 29th: Scottsdale, ArizonaNovember 12th: New York CityDecember 5th: Ann

item.title: Barclays: The Fed is expected to begin cutting interest rates in September, previously anticipated in December
item.description: August 23rd - The cross-border financial services provider Barclays announced that it anticipates the Fed to commence cutting interest rates in September. This is earlier than the previous anticipation of December. (FXStreet)

item.title: If Bitcoin surpasses $119,000, the mainstream CEX cumulative short liquidation intensity will reach 8.58 billion.
item.description: On August 23rd, based on Coinglass data, if Bitcoin manages to break through $119,000, the total short liquidation intensity on mainstream CEX will ascend to $8.58 billion.Conversely, in the event that Bitcoin drops below $115,000, the total long liquidation intensity on mainstream CEX will reach $7.83 billion.BlockBeats' Note: The liquidation chart does not disclose the precise number of contracts set to be liquidated or the exact value of the contracts being liquidated. The bars on the liquidation chart actually signify the significance of each liquidation cluster in relation to neighboring liquidation clusters, that is, intensity.Consequently, the liquidation chart reveals to what extent the price of the underlying asset will be influenced when it attains a certain level. A more elevated "liquidation bar" indicates that the price will undergo a more vigorous reaction due to a surge in liquidity when it reaches that particular level.

item.title: Ethereum Market Cap Surpasses Mastercard Once Again, Ranks 26th in Global Asset Market Cap Leaderboard
item.description: On August 23rd, based on 8marketcap data, Ethereum's market capitalization ($578.89 billion) once more exceeded that of Mastercard ($540.52 billion). It showed a 24-hour growth of 12.99% and a 7-day growth of 8.28%. Temporarily, it ranked 26th on the global asset market capitalization list.

item.title: In the past 4 hours, Ethereum Liquidations reached $181 million, and Bitcoin Liquidations reached $41.5092 million
item.description: On August 23rd, according to Coinglass data, during the past 4 hours, the total liquidation of Ethereum reached $181 million. In contrast, during the same period, the liquidation amount of Bitcoin was only $41.5092 million.Throughout the past 24 hours, there was a total of $655 million in liquidations across the entire network. The long liquidations amounted to $231 million, and the short liquidations totaled $424 million.

item.title: Cryptocurrency total market capitalization rebounds to $4.125 trillion, with a 24-hour increase of 5.4%.
item.description: On August 23rd, based on Coingecko data, the total market capitalization of cryptocurrencies has risen to $4.125 trillion, showing a 24-hour increase of 5.4% and a 24-hour trading volume of $1950.946 billion.The total market capitalization of Bitcoin is $2.33 trillion, and the total market capitalization of Ethereum is $578.99 billion.

item.title: Bitcoin Withdrawal Trend Slows Down, with a CEX Net Inflow of 4,041.38 BTC in the Last 24 Hours
item.description: August 23rd. Based on Coinglass data, within the past 24 hours, CEX has witnessed a net inflow of 4,041.38 BTC. The top three CEX inflows are as follows:· OKX had a net inflow of 2,627.08 BTC;· Bitfinex had a net inflow of 1,799.34 BTC;· Coinbase Pro had a net inflow of 975.24 BTC.In addition, Kraken saw a net outflow of 4,306.33 BTC, ranking first in terms of outflows.Earlier today, BlockBeats reported that Ethereum withdrawal momentum has eased, with a net inflow of 22,600 ETH on CEX in the past 24 hours.

item.title: LookOnChain: Bitcoin Breaks $117,000
item.description: Update: On August 23rd, as per HTX market data, Bitcoin witnessed a rebound and surpassed $117,000, registering a 24-hour gain of 4.17%.
